summary: The text discusses the Water Resources Regulations of Nepal, published in the Nepal Gazette in 2050. It outlines the rights granted by the Water Resources Act of 2049 and the regulations governing the use of water resources. It defines terms related to water resources and the establishment of consumer organizations. The regulations also cover the registration and functioning of consumer organizations, as well as the rights and responsibilities of members.

It outlines the rules and procedures governing the service conditions of the members of the commission, as well as the powers and responsibilities of the commission as per the Commission for Investigation of Abuse of Authority Act, 2026. The rules emphasize ethical conduct, impartiality, and accountability of the members in carrying out their duties.

summary: The text discusses various legal amendments related to the formation and functioning of the Investigation Commission in Nepal. It includes amendments to the Commission Act of 2026, the first amendment to the Commission Act of 2050, and other laws related to the Constitution and legal system in Nepal. The text emphasizes the establishment and powers of the Investigation Commission, as well as the procedures for making amendments to existing laws.

summary: The text discusses the legal provisions related to discrimination and bias in Nepal, including the National and Other Discrimination and Punishment Act of 2068. It also mentions amendments to various laws to address social discrimination and bias. The document emphasizes the importance of upholding human dignity and rights, promoting equality, and combating discriminatory practices in society. It outlines the definitions of discrimination, social status, and public services, as well as the application of laws to both government and non-government entities.

summary: The text discusses the "National Discrimination and Untouchability (Crime and Punishment) Regulations, 2074" published in the Nepal Gazette. It outlines the rules and procedures related to discrimination and untouchability, as per the provisions of the 2068 Act. The regulations provide guidelines for reporting and addressing cases of discrimination and untouchability, including the process for filing complaints and seeking redress through the relevant authorities. The regulations aim to combat discrimination and promote equality in Nepali society.
